intro: Pseudosericocoma, commonly known as the false silkweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Pseudosericocoma species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the biodiversity of their native habitats.
